com.complexible.common.iterations

Class DelegatingIteration<T,E extends Exception>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.complexible.common.iterations.DelegatingIteration<T,E>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, Iteration<T,E>

    public abstract class DelegatingIteration<T,E extends Exception>
extends Object
implements Iteration<T,E>

    Implementation of an Iteration which delegates its methods to a child Iteration.

    Since:
    2.0

      • close

        public void close()
           throws E extends Exception
        Description copied from interface: Iteration
        Close the iterator. This signals that it is ok to free up any resources used by the implementation. It is expected, but not required, that subsequent calls to Iteration.hasNext() or Iteration.next() would fail and throw an exception, such as an IllegalStateException.
        Specified by:
        close in interface Closeable
        Specified by:
        close in interface Iteration<T,E extends Exception>
        Throws:
        E - if there is an exception while closing
        E extends Exception
